answers.answer: HiNumbness in hand can be due to a lot of causes such as repetitive-stress motion disorder, compression of the cervical nerve root in the neck, diabetes, heart disease, vitamin deficiency, thyroid problems etc. What did the neurologist say about your condition? If the symptoms do not resolve or worsen, you should go in for another opinion from a doctor.Regards

question: i have numbness in my left hand and i did the MRI the results seemed to be all normal, i am a left-handed person, i cant write properly..when i hold objects it drops from my hand, numb sensation mostly at the tip of my fingers, i have been to a neurologist( consultant ) and i didn't come up with anything from the doc. PLEASE HELP ME!"
title: numbness
